medical_history.chief_complaint: Respiratory distress and metabolic complications in a premature infant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The infant developed respiratory distress approximately 10 minutes after delivery, with an acute drop in oxygen saturation from 90% to 50% at 15 minutes of life. The patient's condition included repeated severe metabolic acidosis, hyperkalemia, hypocalcemia, and hyperglycemia, alongside episodic oxygen desaturation and persistent hypoxemia despite multiple rounds of pulmonary surfactant therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The couple's first child was delivered at 28 weeks with a history of bilateral renal cysts and severe oligohydramnios, and did not survive after delivery. No other relevant past medical conditions were mentioned.
medical_history.family_history: The couple was unaware of other renal, liver or pancreatic disease cases in their families.
medical_history.social_history: The mother had no history of prenatal exposure to alcohol, drugs, or medications.
